text:
Created attachment 9818
rev3 of patch

Finn,

Ive got to bottom of what JBuilder was doing so there shouldnt be any problems 
with LFs in this patch.

1) Ive fixed the problem with color. the color was being changed for fill but 
the change requires the use of stroking. So now the color changes for stroking 
ops.
2) I knew this wasnt quite right, but then I didnt think it was quite right 
before. Ive had a play with the positions so that they do not overlay the 
inner text. If you want me to change it again I'm happy to, just provide the 
specifics of what you want.
creator: bowditch_chris@hotmail.com

text:
Regarding the positioning of the border, there is a number of missing pieces in 
both the rendere and layout. And I believe that the problem can't be fixed only 
in PDFRendere.
I've assumed that the rectangle given to drawBackAndBorder() was (or should be) 
the "border rectangle" of a block area.

  http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xsl-20011015/slice4.html#area-geo

If that assumption holds, and I think it does, then the original placement of 
the border was correct.

I've tried to fix some of the remaining issues regarding position of borders in 
this patch:
   http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25802

text:
Created attachment 9856
rev4 of patch

Finn,

the borders are currently being placed completely inside the area, which 
overwrites the text if the borders are thick, and theres no padding etc. So 
Ive made a 4th patch which places the new dotted/dashed borders completely 
inside the area as well. (as opposed to outside the area as rev3 of the patch 
does)

There are no further issues with this patch that I'm aware of, so it is ready 
to be committed.
creator: bowditch_chris@hotmail.com

text:
I've ran a test of the patch and did a before vs. after comparison. You can 
find the result here (600kb):
   http://bckfnn-modules.sourceforge.net/out-border-patch.pdf

Generally the result is good, but at some zoom values, there are some 
difference in the way the borders are rendered by acrobat.
Some of the difference are good, such as the thinner solid borders.
Some are not-so-good, f.ex at the very first page at 92% zoom, there are a red 
line above the blue top-border. At other zoom levels, the result is fine, and 
at a very high zoom factor, everything look perfect.

Since the result in the PDF is acurate, even if acrobat renders it a bit 
strange, I think the patch can go in.
creator: bckfnn@worldonline.dk

text:
Finn,

Concerning the strange effects in Acrobat: IIC, this is a known problem (esp. 
with Acrobat 5), so you're indeed very right that the problem is Acrobat's 
rendering, and not the PDF itself.

So... we finally get 'dotted' and 'dashed' borders :) Yee-haa!

Cheers,
